org.numenta.nupic.network.sensor

Class HTMSensor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.network.sensor.HTMSensor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the input type (i.e. File, URL, etc.)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable, Sensor<T>

    public class HTMSensor<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sensor<T>, java.io.Serializable

    Decorator for Sensor types adding HTM specific functionality to sensors and streams.

    The HTMSensor decorates the sensor with the expected meta data containing field name and field type information together with the information needed in order to auto-create Encoders necessary to output a bit vector specifically tailored for HTM (Hierarchical Temporal Memory) input.

    This class also has very specific date handling capability for the "timestamp" data field type.

    Output is attained by calling getOutputStream(). This class extends the Stream API to be able to "fork" streams, so that a single stream can supply multiple fanouts.

    Warning: if getOutputStream() is called multiple times, all calls must precede any operations on any of the supplied streams.

    Author:
    David Ray
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createEncoder

        private void createEncoder()

      • makeIndexEncoderMap

        private void makeIndexEncoderMap()
        Sets up a mapping which describes the order of occurrence of comma separated fields - mapping their ordinal position to the Encoder which services the encoding of the field occurring in that position. This sequence of types is contained by an instance of Header which makes available an array of FieldMetaTypes.

      • getInputStream

        public <K> MetaStream<K> getInputStream()

        Main method by which this Sensor's information is retrieved.

        This method returns a subclass of Stream (MetaStream) capable of returning a flag indicating whether a terminal operation has been performed on the stream (i.e. see MetaStream.isTerminal()); in addition the MetaStream returned can return meta information (see MetaStream.getMeta().

        Specified by:

      • input

        private int[] input(java.lang.String[] arr,
                    java.lang.String[] fieldNames,
                    FieldMetaType[] fieldTypes,
                    java.util.List<int[]> outputStreamSource,
                    boolean isParallel)

        Populates the specified outputStreamSource (List<int[]>) with an encoded array of integers - using the specified field names and field types indicated.

        This method process one single record, and is called iteratively to process an input stream (internally by the getOutputStream() method which will process

        WARNING: When inserting data MANUALLY, you must remember that the first index must be a sequence number, which means you may have to insert that by hand. Typically this method is called internally where the underlying sensor does the sequencing automatically.

        Parameters:
        arr - The string array of field values
        fieldNames - The field names
        fieldTypes - The field types
        outputStreamSource - A list object to hold the encoded int[]
        isParallel - Whether the underlying stream is parallel, if so this method executes a binary search for the proper insertion index. The List handed in should thus be a LinkedList for faster insertion.

      • getInputMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getInputMap()
        Return the input mapping of field names to the last input value for that field name. This method is typically used by client code which needs the input value for use with the CLAClassifier.
        Returns:

      • isTerminal

        public boolean isTerminal()

        Returns a flag indicating whether the underlying stream has had a terminal operation called on it, indicating that it can no longer have operations built up on it.

        The "terminal" flag if true does not indicate that the stream has reached the end of its data, it just means that a terminating operation has been invoked and that it can no longer support intermediate operation creation.

        Returns:
        true if terminal, false if not.
